Web\u30a2\u30d7\u30ea\u30b1\u30fc\u30b7\: How to make a web application framework in Python
\"Web\u30a2\u30d7\u30ea\u30b1\u30fc\u30: "How to make a Web application framework in Python
\u3053\u306e\u8cc7\u6599\u306fPyCon JP: This document is based on PyCon JP 2016 `` How to make a Web application framework to learn from the basics' <https://pycon.jp/2016/ja/schedule/presentation/14/> It is a transcript of `_. We will be waiting for Issue or PR if there are misspellings etc.
\u7b46\u8005\u306f\u81ea\u5206\u306e\u4: When I decided to make my best advantage on the server side, I first wanted to know the implementation of major web frameworks such as Django and Flask. It is because I want to be able to fix it myself when I encounter some bug. So while I was a student I was reading the implementation of Bottle and Flask. At first I did not know where to start by reading hands, but I could see the whole picture of various WSGI frameworks by reading while holding my head. I noticed the differences in the design policies of the various frameworks and gained a lot of knowledge about HTTP that I could not notice by merely using the framework. Recently, it has become more common to write languages ​​other than Python such as Go language, but I feel that many knowledge gained here has been useful.
\u3068\u306f\u3044\u3048\u7b46\u8005\u3: However, it is very difficult to read the code base of thousands of lines to hundreds of thousands of lines from the beginning while the knowledge is shallow like the author. This article will explain how to make a simple web framework that is less than 200 lines in a bottom-up manner. Creating a small framework from 1 is an effective way to grasp the overall picture. If you keep down the content to explain here, you will not have much trouble reading Bottle's implementation. Also, when you read Flask or Django, you can imagine where you should start a hand as long as you can read through while understanding the overall picture.
\u3053\u306e\u8cc7\u6599\u3067\u306f\u3: In this article, we will actually create a framework for Web applications in Python. For that reason, I have already experienced web development and I think that it is easy to understand if there is basic HTTP knowledge. If you feel it is difficult as you continue reading, you may want to review these knowledge a bit more. If you do not understand in any way, you can increase Issue to Github, you may increase supplementary explanation about that. Please do not hesitate to contact me.
`Github <https://github.com/c-bata/webf: `Github <https://github.com/c-bata/webframework-in-python> `_ (` WSGI framework <https://github.com/c-bata/webframework-in-python/blob/master/src/app.py> `_ /` WSGI server <https://github.com/c-bata/webframework-in-python/blob/master/src/wsgi_server.py> `_ /` Sample application <https://github.com/c-bata/webframework-in-python/blob/master/src/main.py> `_)
\u6b21\u306fJavaScript\u3084CSS\u3001\u: Next let's add a function to return static files such as JavaScript, CSS, images and so on. In a production environment, it may be returned directly from Nginx etc. from a performance point of view, but it is rather troublesome to set Nginx etc even in the development environment.
\"\u9759\u7684\u30d5\u30a1\u30a4\u30eb\: "There are several ways to add the function to return static files, but this time I will implement it as WSGI middleware.
\"\u30df\u30c9\u30eb\u30a6\u30a7\u30a2\: "Middleware looks like a WSGI application from the Web server side and it looks like a Web server from the WSGI application side.
CSS\u3084JS\u3001\u753b\u50cf\u306a\u30: I think that the delivery of static files such as CSS, JS, images, etc. is often returned by Nginx etc. in the production environment. However it is troublesome to set it to return with Nginx etc. during development.
\u958b\u767a\u74b0\u5883\u3067\u306e\u3: Let's activate middleware that distributes static files only in the development environment. Implementation of static file delivery method is omitted here. Middleware that returns already published static files was old, so many of them were prepared, so I prepared it by the author.
\"\u3053\u306e wsgi-static-middleware \: "Let's validate the static file using this wsgi-static-middleware.
WSGI\u306e\u30df\u30c9\u30eb\u30a6\u30a: When implemented as WSGI middleware, it does not depend on framework implementation. Although the distribution of static files is slightly poor in frameworks such as Bottle, it can be supplemented with the middleware implemented here.
\u6b21\u306f\u30ea\u30af\u30a8\u30b9\u3: Let's think about how to handle request information. We already explained that information on client requests is passed as a dictionary type object to the first argument of the WSGI application. The HTTP method and URL path of the request required for routing must be retrieved from this object as follows.
\"\u307e\u305f\u4ed6\u306b\u3082\u69d8\: "In addition, if various information is stored and you want to retrieve an HTTP request body, for example, it is written as follows.
\u8f9e\u66f8\u578b\u30aa\u30d6\u30b8\u3: We retrieve `` CONTENT_LENGTH`` and `` wsgi.input`` from a dictionary object. `` env [\ "CONTENT_LENGTH \"] `` contains the length of the response body specified by the client in the HTTP header `` Content-Length``. Since the response body is a file object, it needs to be raised by `` read () `` for the length of `` Content-Length``. I think that it is a little hard just to retrieve the request body.
\u3053\u308c\u3089\u3092\u3046\u307e\u3: It is useful if you have a class that will make these easy to wrap and make it easy to use. Most WSGI frameworks provide "request objects" that wrap this. Let's define the `` Request`` class in this framework as well.
\u30ea\u30af\u30a8\u30b9\u30c8\u30aa\u3: What the request object is, it is an object of a class that wraps environ of WSGI. Prepare a `` Response`` class that defines property methods so that various request information stored in WSGI Environ can be retrieved with a simple API.
WSGI Environ\u306b\u306f\u69d8\u3005\u3: Various information is stored in WSGI Environ, but first we have defined only three property methods. If you pass this object of the `` Request`` class, the framework user can get the information of the request body simply by accessing the `` body`` property. Actually, as there are plenty of other information in addition to what I gave here, it is necessary to expand as necessary, but this is the only basic way of thinking. Let's incorporate it into the application next time.
\"\u5404\u95a2\u6570\u306b\u306f\u3001W: "Let's rewrite each function to pass` `Request (env)` `instead of WSGI Environ.
\"\u3053\u308c\u3067 ``Request`` \u30af: "Now you can pass objects of the` `Request`` class to each function, the application side interface looks like this:
\u30ea\u30af\u30a8\u30b9\u30c8\u30dc\u3: There is room for improvement in that all character codes of the request body are treated as `` utf - 8``. In fact it's a good idea to check `` charset`` which is specified in the `` Content-Type`` header. Nonetheless, users of the framework can now easily access the request body. Let's rewrite the existing application.
\u305b\u3063\u304b\u304f\u306a\u306e\u3: Let's make it much more accessible to other information. Wrapping all the information contained in WSGI Environ is not done here, but since the following items are used frequently, I think that it is useful if property methods are defined.
\"`query` \u30d7\u30ed\u30d1\u30c6\u30a: "` query` property: I want to retrieve query parameters of URL easily
\"``env['QUERY_STRING']`` \u3088\u308a\: "You can retrieve it from` `env ['QUERY_STRING']` `and parse it using` `urllib.parse.parse_qs``
`forms` \u30d7\u30ed\u30d1\u30c6\u30a3:: `forms` property: I want to receive parameters sent from an HTML form stored in` `form-urlencoded`` form or` `multipart`` form.
\"\u30ea\u30af\u30a8\u30b9\u30c8\u30dc\: "You can retrieve it from the request body and parse it using` `cgi.FieldStorage``.
\"`text` \u30d7\u30ed\u30d1\u30c6\u30a3: "` text` property: I want to receive the request body in text, not as a byte string.
\"`json` \u30d7\u30ed\u30d1\u30c6\u30a3: "` json` property: I want to json decode the contents of the request body and receive it as a dictionary type object.
\"\u30b3\u30fc\u30c9\u306f\u305d\u308c\: "The code is not that difficult, so I will omit a detailed explanation, but the property method is as follows.
\u3053\u3053\u3067\u306f\u30ea\u30af\u3: We reviewed the handling of request objects here. In WSGI Environ, retrieving request information was a little troublesome as it was, but by preparing a request class that wraps it, various property information can be easily retrieved through property method. Let's revise the response information to a manageable API next to the request.
\"\u30ea\u30af\u30a8\u30b9\u30c8\u60c5\: "Now that request information can be handled easily, next we will review how to handle response information.The processing of each endpoint was defined as follows.
\u3053\u3053\u3067\u6c17\u306b\u306a\u3: What I care about here is how to return response information. In the WSGI interface, it is specified by the `` start_response`` function which receives the response status and the response header as the second argument. This is somewhat troublesome compared to Flask and Bottle's sample code. It might be useful to have a class wrapping the Response information so that it can be managed more easily. Specifically, we will try to describe the processing of each endpoint as follows.
``Response`` \u30af\u30e9\u30b9\u3068\u: We added a `` Response`` class so that we can specify the response body, header information, and status code numbers there. Since it is wrapped in the class, you can also change the default header information freely by using inheritance.
\"\u30d8\u30c3\u30c0\u30fc\u60c5\u5831\: "How to handle header information and status information easily
Response\u30af\u30e9\u30b9\u3092\u5b9f\: Before implementing the Response class, I will explain in detail how to handle header information and status information easily. First of all, it deals with status information. As the first argument of `` start_response``, you specify the status code as `` 200 OK`` or `` 404 Not Found``, but since the string corresponding to the number is fixed, It is easier to specify only by designation. The `` responses`` object of the `` http.client`` module contains a message for the status code number.
\"\u975e\u5e38\u306b\u7c21\u5358\u306b\: "It was possible to retrieve it very easily, the user can specify the number like` `200`` and generate a status code as follows.
\"\u30b9\u30c6\u30fc\u30bf\u30b9\u60c5\: "The` `Header`` class in the` `wsgiref.headers`` module is useful for managing status information.
``add_header(key, value)`` \u30e1\u30bd: We set the header information through `` add_header (key, value) `` method. In addition, according to WSGI specifications, it is necessary to prepare a list of key and value tuples for header information, but the `` items () `` method spew out header information in that format.
\u30c7\u30d5\u30a9\u30eb\u30c8\u306e\u3: We decided to put default status code and content type in the class variable. The user specifies the content of the response body as a character string, but on the WSGI interface it must return it as an iterable object that yields the byte string. The `` body`` property method properly encodes and returns the string.
\u7d44\u307f\u8fbc\u307f\u306f\u3053\u3: Built-in is thus very simple. Unlike so far, you do not need to pass `` start_response`` to each function. Instead, we need to extract and recall the status information and header information from the returned response object.

\"\u3044\u304b\u304c\u3067\u3057\u3087\: "How about you, have you used Flask or Bottle, have not it become familiar to you so much?
\u3053\u3053\u3067\u306f\u30ec\u30b9\u3: We reviewed the handling of response information here. By adding the Response class we were able to turn it into an API that is user friendly. There are functions that I still want to make applications actually, but it seems that it has become a web framework indeed as long as it comes to this point.
\"\u3053\u3053\u3067\u306f\u5168\u90e8\: "Although we just returned the entire string here, in actual use cases it will return HTML and JSON in many cases We will deal with the contents in the next section.
\u524d\u7ae0\u3067\u306f\u3001WSGI\u306: In the previous chapter, I checked the specification of WSGI and made a small application to satisfy it. Let's actually make a web framework from here.
\u5148\u7a0b\u306e\u30a2\u30d7\u30ea\u3: In the previous application, it returns "Hello World" regardless of the path information of the URL. In an actual application, since there are many pages, it is necessary to return different responses according to the path information. The simplest routing method is shown below.
WSGI\u306e\u30a2\u30d7\u30ea\u30b1\u30f: As a first argument of WSGI's application, a dictionary type object is passed. This is called WSGI Environment, which stores information on requests received from clients. The path information of the request is one of them and can be retrieved by `PATH_INFO`. Also HTTP methods can be retrieved by `` REQUEST_METHOD`` as well.
\"\u3082\u3046\u5c11\u3057\u8907\u96d1\: "Consider a more complicated case, please look at some of the applications of Bottle here.
`/hello/foo` \u3068 `/hello/bar` \u306f: `/ hello / foo` and` / hello / bar` are different endpoints, but in the code above the `greet` function is called. Variables such as `foo` and` bar` (URL variable) are taken from the path information of the URL.

\"\u30eb\u30fc\u30c6\u30a3\u30f3\u30b0\: "Routing image. Call another application according to path information.
\"\u305d\u308c\u3067\u306f\u56f3\u306eR: "Let's implement the routers in the figure.
\"\u305d\u308c\u3067\u306f\u30eb\u30fc\: "Now we will prepare a` `Router`` class that provides routing capabilities, and we have two methods for this class.
\"``add()``: \u5404\u30b3\u30fc\u30eb\u: "` `add ()` `: Register which URL path · HTTP method is associated with each callback function (WSGI application object).
\"``match()``: \u5b9f\u969b\u306b\u53d7: "` `match ()` `: Returns the callback function and URL variable registered based on the path of the actual request and information on the HTTP method.
\"\u307e\u305a\u306f ``add()`` \u30e1\u: "Let's start by defining it from the` `add ()` `method.
HTTP\u30e1\u30bd\u30c3\u30c9\u3068\u30d: We added HTTP methods, paths, and callback functions associated therewith to dictionary type objects and added them to the list. Very easy. What will the caller look like? Define `` match () `` method.
\u3053\u306e\u30e1\u30bd\u30c3\u30c9\u3: In this method, it checks whether the path information and method information of the endpoint registered by the `` add () `` method match. If it matches, it retrieves the URL variable and returns the callback function that was tied. If they do not match, `` 404 Not Found`` is now returned. This is also a very simple code, but basically it has the necessary functions for routing. Just to be sure, let's check the operation.
\"\u3046\u307e\u304f\u52d5\u4f5c\u3057\: "It can be confirmed that it works well. Let's add two improvements in addition here.
\"\u30d1\u30b9\u306f\u5b9a\u7fa9\u3055\: "If the path is defined but only the methods do not match, it returns` `405 Method Not Allowed``.

\"Router\u3092\u7d44\u307f\u8fbc\u3093\: "Make a WSGI application class that incorporates Router
``Router`` \u30af\u30e9\u30b9\u3092\u7d: I'd like to incorporate the `` Router`` class, but it's a bit hard to handle if you keep the function. Let's define the WSGI application in the class here.
\u3053\u3053\u3067\u6ce8\u76ee\u3057\u3: The point to watch out here is that the `` __call __ () `` method is defined. If you define the `` __call__`` method, the object of this class is itself callable. In other words, `` app = App () `` behaves in the same way as the function `` def app (env, start_response): pass``. This makes it much easier to expand. Let's include the `` Router`` class.
``route`` \u30c7\u30b3\u30ec\u30fc\u30b: You can now use the `` route`` decorator to assign paths written in HTTP methods and regular expressions to callback functions. Users of this framework can use it in the following form.

\u3053\u3053\u307e\u3067\u30eb\u30fc\u3: I thought about the role of routing so far and implemented it. The prepared `` Router`` class determines whether or not it matches the path described in the regular expression, and if it matches, it returns the registered callback function and URL variable. By specifying routing information with a decorator, users can better define multiple endpoints forepectedly.

Response\u30aa\u30d6\u30b8\u30a7\u30af\: The Response object was very suitable for returning strings. In fact when developing a web application, it is rare to return such a string in this way, and there are more cases to return HTML for displaying in a web browser or to prepare a JSON format API for client applications. Let's first prepare the JSONResponse class which is useful for developing JSON API.
Bottle\u3084Django\u306e\u3088\u3046\u3: In the framework like Bottle and Django, we prepare our own template engine, but this time, let's return HTML using Jinja 2 which is the de facto standard.

\"\u3053\u308c\u3067\u5b9f\u88c5\u306fO: "Implementation is OK with this, let's use it.
Flask\u3084Django\u3067\u66f8\u304b\u30: When running an application written in Flask or Django, of course, a server is necessary. When running in a production environment gunicorn and uWSGI are widely used.
\u5b9f\u306fPython\u306e\u6a19\u6e96\u3: Actually there is also a server implementation called `` wsgiref`` in the Python standard library. Although there are performance issues such as it only works with single thread, it is included in the standard library and there is no need to install it separately, so this is often used in the development environment. For example, the `` run () `` method provided by Flask class and Django `` manage.py runserver`` will use wsgiref by default.
Web\u30a2\u30d7\u30ea\u3092\u958b\u767a: When developing a Web application, I will run applications created on these servers, but I will explain in detail what kind of exchanges between the Web server and the application we are developing, daily development There is not much to be aware of within. However, when developing a Web framework it is necessary to know how exchanges are being done.
\"\u30b5\u30fc\u30d0\u3068\u30a2\u30d7\: "There is some communication between the server and the application.
Python\u3067\u306f\u30a2\u30d7\u30ea\u3: In Python, as an interface between an application and a Web server `PEP 3333 <https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3333/> WSGI (Web Server Gateway Interface) specification defined by `_ is widely used. Every well-known Python web framework such as Django, Flask, Bottle, Pyramid, etc. conforms to WSGI specifications. Here we will also develop an application framework that conforms to WSGI specifications. By doing this you can use an excellent existing WSGI server such as gunicorn or uWSGI.
`PEP3333 <https://www.python.org/dev/pe: `PEP 3333 <https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3333/> The WSGI version defined in `_ is v1.0.1, but in PEP,` PEP 333 (WSGI v 1.0) <http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0333/> `_ Also exists. Although PEP 333 assumed Python 2, since the handling of the character string changed significantly from Python 3, it was updated accordingly, and other detailed specification changes were added to PEP 3333.
\u305d\u308c\u3067\u306fWSGI\u306e\u4ed: Let's learn about the specification of WSGI. It is hard to read all PEP 3333, so let's understand only the outline based on the actual Python code.
\"\u3053\u306e\u305f\u3063\u305f3\u884c: "This 3 lines of Python code fulfills the WSGI specification.What kind of specification was then? I will explain each line.

\"\u7b2c2\u5f15\u6570\u3068\u3057\u3066: "Call the object passed as the second argument and pass the HTTP status code and header information
\"\u30ec\u30b9\u30dd\u30f3\u30b9\u30dc\: "Return an iterable object that yields a byte string as a response body.

\u52d5\u304d\u307e\u3057\u305f\u304b\uf: Have you moved? If it works normally, when accessing with a web browser etc., it should be displayed as `Hello World` like the above GIF animation. Let's think about the functions necessary for the future web framework in the next chapter.
Hello World\u3092\u8868\u793a\u3059\u30: If it was a simple application that only displayed Hello World, it could be implemented without using framework. So what kind of function does the Web framework provide for Web application development in the future? If you are experienced in web application development, this area will be easy to imagine. As an example, development will be easier if you have the following functions.
\u5148\u307b\u3069\u306eHello World\u30: Hello World comes back no matter where you access the application of Hello World. There are many pages on the actual Web site, and processing on the server side depends on the URL and HTTP method.
\u30ea\u30af\u30a8\u30b9\u30c8\u60c5\u5: Request information is provided as the first argument of the WSGI application, but this is a dictionary type object. Since it is difficult to retrieve GET's query parameters and other request information directly from here, it would be nice to have a class that successfully wraps that information. Also, it seems to be good if there are classes that manage the header information and status information of the response well.
HTML\u3092\u8868\u793a\u3059\u308b\u969: It is useful to evaluate and embed Python variables when displaying HTML. Like Bottle and Django, you may be able to prepare a template engine on your own, but it may be useful to have a loader of template engine already widely used such as Jinja 2. In this time we will prepare a Jinja 2 template engine loader without implementing it from scratch.
CSS\u3084JS\u3001\u753b\u50cf\u30d5\u30: Static files such as CSS, JS, and image files are often returned by Nginx etc. in the production environment. However, it is troublesome to set Nginx settings and return static files on the PC at hand or at hand, so development seems to be improving if the framework also has a function to return static files.
\u3053\u306e\u8cc7\u6599\u3067\u4f5c\u6: Using the framework created in this document, you can write the code as follows. If you are accustomed to developing with Flask or Bottle, you can easily handle it.
\"\u4eca\u306e\u6642\u70b9\u3067\u7406\: "It is not necessary to understand at this point, but I will also put a big picture of the framework.
Router \u3084 Request \u3001 Response \: Implementing Router, Request, Response class one by one gradually approaches the framework described in the above figure. By the time you finish reading this material you will be able to imagine including concepts on how frameworks such as Bottle and Flask are organized.
\u3053\u306e\u7ae0\u3067\u306fWSGI\u306: This chapter explained the outline of WSGI. In addition, the interface provided by WSGI explains the missing functions and introduced the completion form of the Web framework to be created. Let's make the application framework of WSGI together from now.
